results.title: Restoration
results.creator_credit: Michael Hoffman, Sarah Ryan Black, Andy Paterson, Cary Brokaw and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Restoration is a lavish costume drama which follows the story of Robert Merivel (Robert Downey Jr.)a young doctor whose life is changed when he is favoured by King Charles II (Sam Neill). Amidst the decadent opulance of the Restoration court Merivel soon loses sight of his career as a doctor but when he is abandoned by Charles he must return to poverty and find a place in the real world again. Based on the novel by Rose Tremain, Michael Hoffman’s film gives a great sense of life in England during the Restoration period. Sam Neill is excellent as the capricious King and Robert Downey Jr. likeable as the wayward Merivel. With appearances by Meg Ryan, Hugh Grant, Polly Walker, David Thewlis and Ian Mackellan and gorgeous music by Henry Purcell. Winner of 1996 Academy Awards for best Art Direction and Best Costume Design.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Hoffman, Sarah Ryan Black, Andy Paterson, Cary Brokaw and Miramax Films

results.title: Restoration
results.brief_description: An old, frayed photograph depicts the image of a young domestic servant living and working on a NSW property in 1912. Using fragments of memory and ritual, Restoration gradually reveals the events behind the photo. Drenched in colour, this visually sumptuous work reveals that willing submission can disguse a fierce determination to change. In the abscence of any dialogue, the film employs a variety of innovative stylisitic techniques to convey narrative, including an evocative use of non-diegetic sound. The unconventional use of dance to depict the relationship between the maid and the photographer provides a memorable focal point of the film.

results.title: Restoration
results.creator_credit: Christine Hansen, Kate Riedl, Cordelia Beresford and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
On a remote New South Wales property in 1912, the image was captured of a young woman who worked as a maid. Her calm gaze hid passions that emerged to subvert her fate. In Restoration fragments of memory combine in photography and dance to retell her story.
Narelle Benjamin (the maid) and Solon Ulbrich (the photographer) also choreographed the dance sequences.

results.title: Restless rocks
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
From space, the way the continents fit together is apparent. The movements of continents set the stage for the present climatic epoch, with its particular distribution of mountain ranges and ocean currents. Satellites make possible the first global watch on volcanoes, from sparsely inhabited regions to the most populous areas.

results.title: Rest in Power: The Trayvon Martin Story
results.brief_description: This six-part docuseries focuses on the killing of unarmed Florida teenager Trayvon Martin, whose killer was allowed to go free after he claimed self defense.

results.title: Responsive caregiving
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Explores caregiving and considers research on the effects of variations in sleeping, nursing, comforting and disciplining. Observes variations in caregiving in Japan, the U.S., Russia and among the Baka of Cameroon. Examines the importance of responsive interaction in building a positive relationship between the child and caregiver.

results.title: Responsible pet ownership
results.creator_credit: Department of Natural Resources and Environment
results.brief_description: This video contains some practical tips and useful information on the following areas of dog and cat ownership: choosing a pet; taking care of your pet’s health; general wellbeing; cat and dog registration; teaching children how to behave around dogs; knowing the signs of a frightened or threatening dog and more. Begins with five 30 second advertisements which were screened on national television in the year 2000 concerning responsible pet ownership and continues with two short videos on pet owners and their responsibilities to the animals.

results.title: Responsible assertion (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Shows assertive, unassertive and aggressive responses to certain situations. Talks about the rights of individuals in personal confrontations. Shows how to be responsibly assertive, instead of being aggressive or unassertive.

results.title: Responsibility: what limits? ('Those Callaways')
results.brief_description: Excerpt from the 1964 film “Those Calloways”. Presents a story about a man whose private dream of establishing a bird sanctuary interferes with commercial development of a hunting resort. Shows the conflict that arises when he takes the law into his own hands.
